news_header: A badger has won the 2024 Wildlife Photographer of the Year People's Choice Award for a photo capturing it near Banksy-style graffiti.
news_original_title: Badger admiring Banksy-style image wins hearts in wildlife photo competition
news_text: A badger admiring graffiti of itself has won the Natural History Museum's 2024 Wildlife Photographer of the Year People's Choice Award, taken by Ian Wood in St Leonards-on-Sea, England. Wood spent two years photographing badgers and aimed to convey a message about badger culling, which is set to end in England within five years. The award received a record 76,000 votes, with five images displayed online and at the museum until June 29.
